name: Wisard
tagline: Web Internal Structure Action RecorDer - a webdriver based tool for creating Selenium tests
body:
# Wisard
## Web Internal Structure Action RecorDer - a webdriver based tool for creating Selenium tests


### Running wisard

Copy `Wisard.jar` into the same directory as `selenium-server-standalone-2.44.0.jar` and then either double-click `Wisard.jar` or start from the command line with `java -jar Wisard.jar`
Then enter a web URL and click 'Inspect'

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/testingsteve/pagescontent/master/wisard/inspect%20page.png)

The page should load and the 'Elements' tab will show a list of web elements. Clicking on individual elements will highlight them in the browser

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/testingsteve/pagescontent/master/wisard/element%20highlighting.png)

To interact with an element, right-click on it and select 'click' - in this example you can then enter some data into a text field

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/testingsteve/pagescontent/master/wisard/data%20entry.png)

Clicking 'Refresh' rescans the page and now shows the text field is set to the entered data

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/testingsteve/pagescontent/master/wisard/data%20set.png)

This generates java statements that can be 'played back'

    element = driver.findElement(By.name("q"));
    element.clear();
    element.sendKeys("webdriver");

If a webpage opens multiple browsers, they can be switched between by selecting the page you wish to use

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/testingsteve/pagescontent/master/wisard/multiple%20pages.png)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
